action.action-desc: Mr. Huffman introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To prohibit the Export-Import Bank of the United States from providing financial support for certain high carbon intensity energy projects.

section.header: Prohibition on Export-Import Bank support for certain high carbon intensity energy projects
section.text: Section 2(b) of the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 (12 U.S.C. 635(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on support for certain high carbon intensity energy projects

subparagraph.text: The Bank shall not guarantee, insure, extend credit, or participate in the extension of credit in connection with the purchase or sale of any good or service for a high carbon intensity project.
In subparagraph (A), the term high carbon intensity project means a project thatâ€”

clause.text: is designed to generate electricity; and
if completed, would produce at least 500 grams of carbon dioxide per kilowatt-hour of electricity generated by the project.
